sentences.en: ‘I can’t swim.’ ‘I can’t either.’
sentences.cn: “我不会游泳。”“我也不会。

sentences.en: All my friends were either lovey-dovey couples or wild, single girls.
sentences.cn: 我的朋友不是卿卿我我的情侣，就是狂野的单身女郎。

sentences.en: Both groups on either side are just picking off innocent bystanders.
sentences.cn: 对峙双方都只是在瞄准射击无辜的旁观者。

sentences.en: Do either of you smoke cigarettes or drink alcohol?
sentences.cn: 你们俩有人吸烟或喝酒吗？

sentences.en: Either she goes or I go.
sentences.cn: 要么她走，要么我走。

sentences.en: Either you can talk to him, or I will.
sentences.cn: 要么你跟他谈，要么我去。

sentences.en: I haven’t seen the movie and my brother hasn’t either (= he also has not seen it ).
sentences.cn: 我没看过这部电影，我弟弟也没看过。

sentences.en: I'm not sure whether he is trying to be clever or controversial, but either way, such writing smacks of racism.
sentences.cn: 我不知道他是想显示自己聪明还是想引起争论，但不管怎样，这样的文章打击了种族主义。

sentences.en: I've never been one to cluck over babies of either sex.
sentences.cn: 不管是男孩还是女孩，我从来都对小孩没什么兴趣。

sentences.en: It’s not an easy car to drive, and at $40,000 it’s not cheap either.
sentences.cn: 这车不容易开，而且要价4万美元，也不便宜。

sentences.en: Life at high school wasn't a bundle of laughs, either.
sentences.cn: 中学生活也不是充满欢笑。

sentences.en: Most single parents are either divorced or separated.
sentences.cn: 大多数单身父母要么离婚了要么分居了。

sentences.en: On either side of the tracks the ground fell away sharply.
sentences.cn: 跑道两侧都是很陡的斜坡。

sentences.en: She drove away before either of them could speak again.
sentences.cn: 没等他俩中任何一人再开口，她就驾车而去。

sentences.en: Sightseeing is best done either by tour bus or by bicycles.
sentences.cn: 最好是乘坐旅游巴士或骑自行车观光。

sentences.en: The musicians stationed themselves quickly on either side of the stairs.
sentences.cn: 乐师们很快就静候在了楼梯的两边。

sentences.en: There’s tea or coffee – you can have either.
sentences.cn: 有茶和咖啡，你可任选一种。

sentences.en: To capture his equity, Murphy must either sell or refinance.
sentences.cn: 要获得资产净值，墨菲必须出售或者重新融资。

sentences.en: We can offer a comfortable home to a young person of either sex.
sentences.cn: 我们可以为年轻的男性或女性提供舒适的住处。

sentences.en: We sat primly at either end of a long settee.
sentences.cn: 我们非常拘谨地坐在长椅的两头。

sentences.en: You are either very young or an incurable optimist.
sentences.cn: 你要么非常年轻，要么是个不可救药的乐天派。

sentences.en: You can park on either side of the street.
sentences.cn: 这条街两边都可停车。

phrases.tran_cn: 无论是（两者中的）哪种情况，（两种情况）无论何者为实

trans.tran_cn: 两者之中任一的；两者之中每一的

trans.tran_en: used to show that a negative statement is also true about another thing or person, or to add a different negative statement about something or someone

trans.tran_cn: 也（用于否定句或否定词组后）；根本

trans.tran_en: one or the other of two; it does not matter which
one or the other of two things or people

trans.tran_cn: （两者之中）任意一个，两者都(不)
